articles.title: DPRK Side Takes Steps for Legally Disposing of Properties of South Side in Mt. Kumgang Resort
articles.content:
DPRK Side Takes Steps for Legally Disposing of Properties of South Side in Mt. Kumgang Resort

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the DPRK Guidance Bureau of Special Zone for International Tour of Mt. Kumgang issued the following statement Monday: 
					
					A series of contacts were made between the north and the south of Korea recently to adjust the properties of the south side in the Mt. Kumgang area.
					
					The adjustment is a compatriotic step taken by the DPRK to protect the properties of enterprises of the south side in Mt. Kumgang resort by law and ensure their profit-making activities according to the DPRK Law on Special Zone for International Tour of Mt. Kumgang.
					
					In order to protect the properties of enterprises of the south side which have suffered a big loss due to the south Korean authorities' unilateral suspension of tour, the DPRK has so far provided several opportunities for negotiations and made every sincere effort, advancing a variety of choices so that the properties may be dealt with according to the will of enterprises of the south side.
					
					The south Korean authorities, however, viciously obstructed the adjustment of properties, groundlessly asserting that it is a "violation of agreement" and "encroachment on the right to properties." In the end they resorted to undisguised delaying tactics, running the whole gamut of sleight of hand.
					
					The DPRK side tried to settle the issue through negotiations while repeatedly postponing the date. Now that the south Korean authorities are persistently disturbing the adjustment of properties, the DPRK side, as already declared, notified the south side on July 29 that the properties of the south side would be legally dealt with according to the DPRK law and in case the enterprises of the south side do not witness the adjustment within three weeks, the former would consider that the latter totally forfeited the right to properties and strictly dispose of them.
					
					Even in that case the DPRK side showed such magnanimity as extending the delay of legal disposal as requested by the enterprises which responded to the proposal for witnessing the adjustment and giving time to choose the method of dealing with properties.
					
					The puppet group not only ignored even the last opportunity given by the DPRK but challenged it, talking about "lawsuit" like a thief crying "Stop the thief!"
					
					It was the puppet group which scrapped the agreement between the DPRK and the Hyundai Group on tour of Mt. Kumgang and blatantly defied the DPRK's patience and sincere efforts to protect the right to properties of enterprises of the south side. It is the height of shamelessness for the group to talk about "violation of agreement" and "encroachment upon the right to properties".
					
					The group has unilaterally kept the tour of Mt. Kumgang in suspension for three years and, consequently, there is no hope of making it afloat in the future. Yet, it is talking about 'bringing a lawsuit" against the DPRK side. This would bring only disgrace to it and become laughing stock. 
					
					Through the August 19 contact the DPRK side finally confirmed that the puppet group has no intention to resume the tour of Mt. Kumgang and respond to the adjustment of properties but is keen to realize its sinister intention to use noble tourism  for the purpose of confrontation.
					
					It is needless to say that there will be neither magnanimity nor generosity for such hooligans who behave as they please without having their business registered in the area where the DPRK's sovereignty is exercised.
					
					Now that the south Korean authorities finally refused to resume tour of Mt. Kumgang and register properties despite the sincere efforts of the DPRK, the Guidance Bureau of Special Zone for International Tour of Mt. Kumgang of the DPRK solemnly declares the following steps according to the relevant law including Article 26 and Article 40 of the Law on Special Zone for International Tour of Mt. Kumgang:
					
					Firstly, the DPRK considers that the south Korean authorities totally abandoned the protection of properties and interests of enterprises of the south side and from now on makes a real legal disposal of all the properties including real estates, equipment and vehicles of the south side in the Special Zone for International Tour of Mt. Kumgang.
					
					Secondly, the DPRK bans taking materials and properties of enterprises of the south side out of Mt. Kumgang resort from 00:00 on August 21.
					
					Thirdly, personnel from the south side in the Special Zone for International Tour of Mt. Kumgang should leave it within 72 hours.
					
					The puppet conservative group is entirely to blame for the situation today when the tour of Mt. Kumgang has reached such a deplorable pass though it had been under way amid the attention of all Koreans and the whole world and its crimes will be denounced and cursed by them for all ages.

articles.title: Chinese Yanbian Daily Delegation Visits Statue of President Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Chinese Yanbian Daily Delegation Visits Statue of President Kim Il Sung

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- A delegation of Yanbian Daily of China led by its Manager Ri Yong Monday visited the statue of President Kim Il Sung standing on Mt. Ryongnam.
					
					It laid bouquets before his statue in boundless reverence for the President and paid homage to him.

articles.title: Foreigners Visit Ssangun-ri Revolutionary Site
articles.content:
Foreigners Visit Ssangun-ri Revolutionary Site

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- The military attaches corps here visited Ssangun-ri revolutionary site on Aug. 22 on the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					Being briefed on the feats of Kim Jong Il possessed of personality and quality as a brilliant commander who started the Songun revolutionary leadership by giving on-the-spot guidance to Seoul Ryu Kyong Su 105 Guards Tank Division of the Korean People's Army, the corps looked round the monument to the field guidance of President Kim Il Sung, a monument of a dedicated poem and soldiers' hall and other places.
					
					At the end of the visit Sun Yanfeng, military, naval and air attache of the Chinese embassy who is doyen of the corps, wrote in the visitor's book that he wished the division success in bolstering its combat capability under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Visits
articles.content:
Visits

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Ministry of Land and Environmental Conservation led by Vice-minister Kim Kyong Jun left here Monday to visit China.
					
					Arriving here on the same day were a delegation of the Eastern Military District of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation headed by Commander of the district Konstantin Sidenko and a delegation of People's Daily led by Secretary General Yan Xiaoming.

articles.title: Korean People Excited to Hear News of Kim Jong Il's Visit to Russia
articles.content:
Korean People Excited to Hear News of Kim Jong Il's Visit to Russia

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- Officials in various fields and servicepersons of the DPRK are greatly excited to hear the news of leader Kim Jong Il's visit to Siberia and the Far East Region of the Russian Federation and filled with boundless longing and reverence for him as he has made endless journeys of forced march for great dedication to the country and the people.
					
					Picturing to himself Kim Jong Il who is on a foreign trip without being relieved of the fatigue pent up while providing Songun revolutionary leadership day and night, Jo Pyong Ju, vice-premier of the Cabinet, had this to say:
					
					The whole country is now swept by a hot wave of general offensive for flinging open the gate to a thriving nation in 2012 without fail.
					
					It was against this backdrop that Kim Jong Il is paying his historic visit to the Russian Federation.
					
					The officials of the Cabinet wholeheartedly hope for the good health of Kim Jong Il paying a visit to the Russian Federation, another brilliant chapter in the history of the DPRK-Russia friendship being given steady continuity generation after generation and are firmly determined to honor the sense of obligation as his soldiers and materialize with loyalty the grandiose plan of the Workers' Party of Korea for building an economic power.
					
					General of the Korean People's Army Kim U Ho said that the news of the Supreme Commander's unofficial visit to Russia filled the hearts of the servicepersons with boundless longing for him.
					
					He is a kind-hearted father, indeed, as he regards it as his greatest pleasure to be among our soldiers and people, Kim U Ho noted, and continued:
					
					Holding in high esteem the great Songun brilliant commander revered by the world people, we will defend the socialist country as firm as an iron wall and creditably discharge our mission as a driving force in the on-going great advance for building a prosperous and powerful country with the pride and self-esteem that they are led by him. 
					
					Ri Kyong Sik, minister of Agriculture, said that the ardent longing for Kim Jong Il is the source of the strength to bring about a fresh turn in grain production.
					
					An Jong Su, minister of Light Industry, said he would exert all efforts to make all light industry factories increase the production of quality consumer goods and thus contribute to powerfully demonstrating the might of the harmonious whole between the leader and the people during Kim Jong Il's visit to Russia.
					
					He noted that the Korean people are eagerly waiting for Kim Jong Il's return home.

articles.title: DPRK Women Judoists Prove Successful in Military Games
articles.content:
DPRK Women Judoists Prove Successful in Military Games

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- The DPRK won two gold medals in the women's judo event of the 5th World Military Games held in Brazil in July.
					
					Judoists from 54 countries competed in the judo matches.
					
					DPRK girls defeated Venezuelan, Polish, Italian and Romanian judoists in preliminaries, quarterfinals and semifinals.
					
					An Kum Ae, 31, trounced the Brazilian rival in the finals of the 52kg category held on July 20.
					
					She took a gold medal as well as the best player prize.
					
					She won gold medals at the World Cup Women's Judo Tournament held in 2010 and other international tournaments.
					
					Kim Sol Mi, 21, also defeated the Brazilian rival in the 48kg category finals.
					
					The gold medalists told KCNA that they did their best to delight Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Gets Familiar with Project for Renovating Pyongyang-Nampho Old Road
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Gets Familiar with Project for Renovating Pyongyang-Nampho Old Road

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim got familiar with the project for renovating the Pyongyang-Nampho old road on the spot.
					
					After going round various places of the project, he held a consultative meeting of officials concerned on the spot.
					
					Discussed at the meeting were the measures for finishing the project on the highest level in a brief span of time and substantially supplying raw materials for the project at relevant fields.

articles.title: First Rason International Trade Fair Opens
articles.content:
First Rason International Trade Fair Opens

					Rason, August 22 (KCNA) -- The First Rason International Trade Fair Monday opened with due ceremony in Rason, an economic trade zone in the northeastern part of Korea adjacent to China and Russia.
					
					Its participants laid bouquets before the portraits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in the exhibition hall before paying tribute to them.
					
					Present at the ceremony were Jo Jong Ho, chairman of the Rason City People's Committee who is chairman of the organizing committee of the fair, officials concerned, officials of the units in the city which presented commodities to the fair, scientists and technicians, representatives of different countries and regions, foreigners who presented commodities to the fair and foreign businessmen active in the Rason economic and trade zone and the consul generals of China and Russia in Chongjin.
					
					An opening address and a congratulatory speech were made there.
					
					The speakers referred to the fact that the fair was opened thanks to the joint efforts of the governments, economic organs, trading companies and personages of different countries.
					
					Noting that the fair would provide the participants with opportunities to conduct multi-faceted commercial and trade activities and scientific and technological exchanges, they expressed hope that they would achieve good successes through wide-ranging contacts.
					
					At the end of the ceremony the participants looked round electrical  and electronic products, light industry goods, foodstuff, medicaments, vehicles and other commodities presented by more than 110 units of the DPRK, China, Russia, Australia, Italy, the U.S. and Taipei of China.
					
					A reception was given on the same day in connection with the inauguration of the fair.

articles.title: National Ssirum Tournament to Be Held in Pyongyang
articles.content:
National Ssirum Tournament to Be Held in Pyongyang

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- The 9th National Ssirum (Korean wrestling) Tournament for Grand Bull Prize will take place on Rungna Islet in Pyongyang from August 24 to 26.
					
					The annual event attracts increasing public interest in the DPRK.
					
					Pyongyang citizens won the first six tournaments but Ri Jo Won from North Phyongan Province took the prize in the last two tournaments.
					
					If Ri wins this year's tournament, too, the gold cowbell will go to him for his three-game winning streak.
					
					He is considered one of the most hopefuls.
					
					All provinces and municipalities will send their best players to Pyongyang for the Grand Bull Prize.
					
					The grand bull weighs nearly one metric ton.

articles.title: New Invention for Dental Correction Made in Korea
articles.content:
New Invention for Dental Correction Made in Korea

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang Medical College of         Kim Il Sung University invented a new dental correction device. 
					
					The existing devices are complicated in operation and take a long time in treatment. 
					
					Pae Jae Son, a 47-year old researcher of the university, told KCNA that the new invention is a very small screw which is implanted on tooth root.
					
					It is considered a better device for dental correction.
					
					The titanium-made screw is low in production cost and simple in operation.
					
					It also takes a short time in treatment.
					
					The new invention has already been introduced in Pyongyang City Dental Preventive Hospital and other dental hospitals in the country.

articles.title: Jang Yong Sil, Celebrated Technician of Korea
articles.content:
Jang Yong Sil, Celebrated Technician of Korea

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- Jang Yong Sil was a celebrated technician who contributed to the development of astronomy and meteorology.
					
					Jang, born into a slave family, invented new astronomical observation apparatuses, metal types and musical instruments. 
					
					His talents were so great that he was known to Sejong King of the Ri Dynasty (1392-1910).
					
					He joined in casting metal types for several years from 1432 and invented various astronomical observation apparatuses. 
					
					After studying machines made in other countries, he invented Jagyokru, an automatic water clock. 
					
					He then made a solar clock and other observation instruments needed for a large observatory. 
					
					He also invented a copper rain gauge, which was used throughout the country for hundreds of years.

articles.title: Ryongaksan Spring Water Factory
articles.content:
Ryongaksan Spring Water Factory

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- The Ryongaksan Spring Water Factory produces bottled mineral water with well-known spring water from Mt. Ryongak in Pyongyang.
					
					The factory began operation on May 31, Juche 96 (2007).
					
					The water, containing various kinds of mineral matters and ions like fluorine, bromine and selenium, is good in taste and efficacious in medical treatment. The products are supplied to Pyongyang citizens.
					
					When visiting the factory in January 2011, leader Kim Jong Il looked around water filtering, cleansing, injecting, forwarding and other processes to acquaint himself with the construction of the factory, its technical equipment and production.
					
					He called on the factory to steadily increase the production and fully supply quality mineral water to Pyongyang citizens.
					
					The modern factory covers thousands of square meters.

articles.title: Ri Sun Sin, Famous Admiral
articles.content:
Ri Sun Sin, Famous Admiral

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- Ri Sun Sin (1545-1598) was a famous admiral who distinguished himself in sea battles. 
					
					Ri, well up in both literary and military arts, had taken important posts in the naval forces from February 1591.
					
					In particular, he made a turtle-shaped iron-clad warship, the first of its kind in the world, to greatly contribute to the Imjin Patriotic War (Apr. 1592-Nov. 1598).

articles.title: May Day Stadium
articles.content:
May Day Stadium

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- May Day Stadium on Rungna Islet in Pyongyang is the biggest stadium in the DPRK.
					
					The parachute-shaped stadium covers more than 400 000 square meters. Its floor space is more than 166 000 square meters and its total floor space is some 207 000 square meters.
					
					The stadium has a football field, 400-meter-long running track and basketball and volleyball courts.
					
					The 8-storied stadium with 150 000 seats also has training halls, resting rooms, indoor swimming pool, health center and cafeteria for players and lounges, soft drink counters and service facilities for spectators, telex room, press center and interview rooms.
					
					The stadium was opened on May 1, Juche 78 (1989). Since then it has served as venues of many events, including the 13th World Festival of Youth and Students and international games.
					
					The grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang" has been held at the stadium since 2002.

articles.title: Tangun's Mausoleum
articles.content:
Tangun's Mausoleum

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- King Tangun's mausoleum is situated on the ridge of Mt. Taebak in Munhung-ri, Kangdong County, Pyongyang.
					
					Tangun is the founder of Ancient Korea, the first state in the East that existed from the early 30th century B.C. to 108 B.C., covering vast areas of Northeast Asia centering on Pyongyang.
					
					The pyramid-shape stone mausoleum is a structure of regular square, 50 meters wide in one side at the bottom and 22 meters high. It covers 45 hectares.
					
					The 9-stair structure is made up of 1 994 trimmed granite pieces and has two stone gates, each weighing 1.2 tonnes.
					
					Two big glass tubes containing the remains of Tangun and his wife are on a large stone stand in the chamber. Tangun's portrait is hanging on a wall of the chamber.
					
					The mausoleum is surrounded by sculptures of Korean tigers, pipha-shape daggers and Tangun's sons and vassals.
					
					The original tomb of Tangun was excavated and confirmed in Juche 82 (1993) under the guidance of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					The excavation proved in a scientific way that Tangun was not a myth but a real human being who was born 5011 (Â±267) years ago from the year of excavation and that he was the ancestral father of the Korean nation.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Songun Politics
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Songun Politics

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- The Songun politics serves as a powerful weapon for leading the cause of independent reunification to victory and a national banner encouraging all Koreans at home and abroad in the nation-wide patriotic struggle to meet challenges of the anti-reunification forces.
					
					Rodong Sinmun Monday says this in a bylined article.
					
					The idea of "By our nation itself" helped promote the advance of the era of independent reunification and imbued all Koreans with a bright prospect of the nation. This would be unthinkable without the great Songun politics, the article says, and goes on:
					
					Thanks to the Songun politics there arrived the June 15 era of reunification when the nation made a dynamic advance in the idea of "By our nation itself" and a firm foundation of independent reunification, peace and prosperity was laid despite outside forces' desperate moves for aggression. It is also thanks to the great Songun politics that the destiny of the nation and peace on the Korean Peninsula have been firmly preserved and the enthusiasm of the fellow countrymen for reunification has run high despite the evermore undisguised moves of the warmongers at home and abroad for a war of aggression against the north.
					
					It is ascribable to the Songun politics that the DPRK is shedding its rays as a bulwark for independent reunification and a beacon of hope for all Koreans.
					
					All Koreans at home and abroad are drawing inexhaustible strength and courage from the Songun politics which helps foil every vicious move of the warmongers for a war and bring the cause of independent reunification to an uninterrupted surge and turning out as one in the patriotic movement for reunification with strong grit and optimism.

articles.title: Stop to UFG Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Stop to UFG Demanded in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Measure Committee for Probing the Truth about Environment Pollution in the U.S. Military Base in Kunsan and Urging Its De-pollution held an anti-U.S. rally outside the base on August 17, the south Korean Yonhap News reported.
					
					At the rally speakers termed the Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises started by the U.S. and the south Korean warmongers on August 16 very dangerous saber-rattling targeted against the north.
					
					They demanded an immediate stop to the aggressive joint military exercises gravely threatening the peace on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: S. Korean Chief Executive Accused of Inciting Confrontation and War
articles.content:
S. Korean Chief Executive Accused of Inciting Confrontation and War

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCN) -- On the very day the Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises were kicked off the south Korean chief executive convened "Ulji meeting of the State Council" in the underground shelter of Chongwadae to finally examine the mobilization posture for a war.
					
					Rodong Sinmun Monday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					The chief executive talked rubbish about the "era of peace and cooperation" in the "address at a meeting celebrating August 15." The next day he kicked off war exercises for invading the DPRK. This is an intolerable mockery of the public at home and abroad desirous of detente and peace on the Korean Peninsula and a blatant challenge to the DPRK.
					
					If the south Korean ruling quarters persist in the moves to escalate confrontation and ignite a war while remaining hostile toward the DPRK, the inter-Korean relations can never get rid of the present catastrophic phase. The madcap UFG now underway in south Korea clearly proves once again who is real harasser of peace and the worst warmonger who has put the inter-Korean relations at the lowest ebb and driven the situation to the brink of a war.
					
					It is a great miscalculation for the south Korean authorities to think that they can get something through the large-scale saber-ratting kicked off together with outsiders.
					
					If the south Korean conservative ruling forces truly want peace on the peninsula and improved inter-Korean relations, they had better halt the provocative war maneuvers.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Internet Homepage of Peruvian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Internet Homepage of Peruvian Organization

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship on August 13 posted on its Internet homepage the full text of leader Kim Jong Il's work "The Songun-based Revolutionary Line Is a Great Revolutionary Line of Our Era and an Ever-Victorious Banner of Our Revolution".
					
					The work, published on January 29, Juche 92 (2003), clarifies the idea that the Workers' Party of Korea's Songun revolutionary line, Songun politics is a powerful political mode of the present era which inherited and developed President Kim Il Sung's idea and line of attaching importance to arms and a scientific revolutionary line, a political mode which most correctly reflects the requirements of the times and the revolution. It also clarifies the validity, advantages and great vitality of the Songun politics.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Songun Leadership Marked by Brazilian Organization
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Start of Songun Leadership Marked by Brazilian Organization

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- The Brazil-Korea Friendship Association on August 10 issued bulletin titled "Kim Jong Il, Songun leadership and modern Korea" on the 51st anniversary of his start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					The bulletin in an article said his Songun leadership put the military power of the DPRK and its single-minded unity on the highest level.
					
					It also brought about the world-startling changes in all fields including economy, the bulletin noted.
					
					His line of building an economic power in the era of Songun provided a sure guarantee for developing the country's economy despite the vicious moves of the imperialists for aggression, sanctions and blockade, it said, and went on:
					
					The DPRK successfully launched satellites by its own efforts in 1998 and 2009 and pushed forward the updating in the fields such as machine building, steel and foodstuff industries.
					
					The land of the whole country was realigned into large-scale standardized fields, gravity-fed waterways completed in succession and genetic and biological engineering made leaping progress to lay a foundation for effecting a turn in grain production.
					
					The slogan "Push Back the Frontiers of Latest Science and Technology!" is ringing out in all fabrics of social life including education, public health, literature and arts.
					
					The online medical service system was established with the help of latest science and technology, cultural centers including the Grand People's Study House are flung open to the people and they are spending pleasant time at the fun fairs including the Kaeson Youth Park at the foot of Moran Hill.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked by International and Brazilian Organizations
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked by International and Brazilian Organizations

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- An international organization and a Brazilian organization carried special write-ups on the 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					The Korean Friendship Association on August 8 posted on its Internet homepage One Corea Network an article titled "With superb guerrilla war methods" with a photo of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					Korea's liberation was a victory of his superb guerrilla methods, the article said, adding he created many guerrilla methods in the course of waging the anti-Japanese armed struggle for 15 years.
					
					He won victories only in many battles during the anti-Japanese war with his extraordinary and mysterious war methods, finally defeating the Japanese imperialists and achieving the historic cause of Korea's liberation, it noted.
					
					The feats he performed in liberating Korea will shine long in the world history of national liberation struggle, it stated.
					
					The Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea on August 7 carried an article with a photo of his revolutionary activities. The article praised him for liberating Korea and opening a new era of the national liberation struggle in colonies.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Lauded by Cambodian Media
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Lauded by Cambodian Media

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- Cambodian media released reports on the 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					AKP on August 13 said the victory in the anti-Japanese armed struggle led by President Kim Il Sung clearly proved that the people in colonies should counter counter-revolutionary violence by revolutionary violence and only through an organized armed struggle they could beat back imperialist aggressors and achieve liberation and independence of their countries.
					
					The feats he performed by ushering in a new era of the national liberation struggle in colonies are brilliantly recorded in the history of the human cause of independence, it noted.
					
					Apsara TV and Radio on August 15 recalled that occupying Korea for more than 40 years, the Japanese imperialists brought unspeakable sufferings and pain to the Korean people. It went on:
					
					It was thanks to the President that the Korean people were saved and the DPRK, a genuine country of the people, was founded and turned into a powerful socialist state.
					
					The Korean people beat back the aggression of the U.S. imperialists and firmly protected the sovereignty and dignity of the country in the 1950s.
					
					The DPRK resolutely shattered the anti-DPRK moves of the imperialist allied forces and fully demonstrated its might as an invulnerable socialist bulwark in the closing period of the last century and is now successfully attaining the targets for the building of a thriving nation.
					
					The feats he performed by liberating Korea will shine forever along with socialist Korea.

articles.title: U.S.-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises Protested by Austrian Organization
articles.content:
U.S.-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises Protested by Austrian Organization

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- The Left Bloc of the Austrian Trade Union Federation on August 17 sent a letter to the south Korean puppet embassy in Vienna in protest against the U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises.
					
					The letter demanded an immediate stop to the joint military exercises being staged against the DPRK.
					
					It expressed resentment against the U.S. for kicking off the saber-rattling together with the south Korean authorities.
					
					The south Korean authorities faked up the "Cheonan" warship sinking case last year, branded the blasting at the peaceable construction site of the DPRK as shelling by the Korean People's Army and opened fire under this pretext, it charged.
					
					Judging from such acts, it is as clear as noonday that the current joint military exercises are so dangerous that they may lead to a war, it said.
					
					The organization demands once again the U.S. and the south Korean authorities stop at once the saber-rattling which increases the danger of a war, it stressed.
					
					It urged the south Korean authorities to immediately set free all the detained pro-reunification patriots.

articles.title: Statement of Spokesman for DPRK Foreign Ministry Reported by Foreign Media
articles.content:
Statement of Spokesman for DPRK Foreign Ministry Reported by Foreign Media

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- Foreign media on August 17 and 18 reported a statement issued by a spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry denouncing the U.S. and the south Korean authorities for staging the provocative and aggressive Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises despite the repeated warnings of the DPRK.
					
					The Chinese Central TV reported that a spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry in a statement said it is self-evident that the DPRK should put spurs to bolstering its nuclear deterrent for self-defence both in quality and quantity to cope with the joint military exercises kicked off by the U.S. and the south Korean authorities.
					
					Invariable is the stand of the DPRK to preserve peace and denuclearize the peninsula through dialogue and negotiations, the CCTV aired. The spokesman said no attempt on the part of the U.S. to do harm to the DPRK by force of arms can go with dialogue and this will only prompt the DPRK to exercise Korean-style mode of merciless counteraction, it added.
					
					Chinese Internet homepages Xinhua network, Guangming network, Jingji network,  Hong Kong Phoenix Satellite TV, the Indian papers Hindustan Times, Hindu, ASEAN Age and Statesman, the Thai paper Bangkok Post and the SANA and the Central TV of Syria echoed in detail the statement of the spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry.

articles.title: UFG Condemned by Bangladeshi, Ecuadorian Organizations
articles.content:
UFG Condemned by Bangladeshi, Ecuadorian Organizations

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- Bangladeshi and Ecuadorian organizations issued statements condemning the U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises.
					
					The Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea in a statement on August 17 termed the current joint military exercises a threat not only to Asia Pacific including the Korean Peninsula but to the rest of the world.
					
					The present situation fully showed the international community the attitude of the U.S. and the south Korean authorities standing against the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula and peace and stability in Northeast Asia, the statement said.
					
					If they truly want peace and stability, they should stop at once the Ulji Freedom Guardian (UFG) joint military exercises targeted against the DPRK, it noted.
					
					The organization calls upon the Juche idea followers and world progressives to strengthen the movement for solidarity with the DPRK, a socialist fortress, it stressed.
					
					The Ecuador-Guaranda Institute for Friendship and Cultural Solidarity with the Korean People in a statement on August 16 bitterly denounced the U.S. and the south Korean authorities for kicking off UFG despite the open letter of the Panmunjom Mission of the Korean People's Army, straining the situation on the peninsula to an extreme pitch of tension.
					
					The statement expressed the conviction that the Korean people are sure to emerge victorious in the efforts to improve the inter-Korean relations and achieve the peace and reunification of the country while shattering all the moves of the hostile forces to defile the dignity of the DPRK.

articles.title: China Strengthens Ideological Work for Army
articles.content:
China Strengthens Ideological Work for Army

					Beijing, August 21 (KCNA) -- Guo Boxiong, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of China, recently called for conducting the ideological work for officers and soldiers in a substantial way.
					
					During his inspection tour of the Beijing military district, Guo said studying and implementing President Hu Jintao's July 1 important speech is a crucial political task and a long-term strategic duty. 
					
					Every unit should prepare itself to be politically steadfast and ideologically pure, he added.

articles.title: Chinese Vice-Premier Calls for Defense Modernization
articles.content:
Chinese Vice-Premier Calls for Defense Modernization

					Beijing, August 21 (KCNA) -- Zhang Dejiang, vice-premier of the State Council of China, Thursday emphasized the need to modernize the national defense domain.
					
					Inspecting the Space Science and Industry Group, he said the sector of national defense science, technology and industry should adhere to the outlook on the scientific development, make independent innovations and strengthen the training of able persons to greatly contribute to the modernization of national defense and the development of the economy and society.

articles.title: Senior Chinese Official Calls for Developing Higher Education
articles.content:
Senior Chinese Official Calls for Developing Higher Education

					Beijing, August 21 (KCNA) -- Liu Yandong, a state councilor of China, called for making a new turning-point in the development of higher education. 
					
					Addressing the 21st meeting of the consultative committee of university affairs under the Ministry of Education, she said universities should remain faithful to the leadership of the Communist Party, observe education and teaching rules and improve their management.

articles.title: Russia Calls for Boosting Cooperation with Belarus
articles.content:
Russia Calls for Boosting Cooperation with Belarus

					Moscow, August 21 (KCNA) -- Russian Premier Vladimir Putin recently called for intensifying economic cooperation between his country and Belarus.
					
					Addressing at a Russia-Belarus cabinet meeting, Putin said the world economy remains uncertain, fraught with a great danger, with the U.S. credit rating falling and the debt problem getting serious in the euro zone. 
					
					Under this situation, Russia and Belarus should pool efforts to the maximum, he said. They should also make an effective use of integration possibilities and cooperation means to actively deal with a possible outbreak of danger.

articles.title: Russian President Congratulates Builders
articles.content:
Russian President Congratulates Builders

					Moscow, August 21 (KCNA) -- Russian President Dmitri Medvedev recently congratulated officials and meritorious workers of the construction sector on the Day of Builders.
					
					In his congratulatory message the president said what is important now is to increase construction projects and ensure their quality, security and convenience. 
					
					It is also important to train experts capable of fulfilling new and wide-ranging tasks.

articles.title: Russia Plans to Launch GPS Satellites
articles.content:
Russia Plans to Launch GPS Satellites

					Moscow, August 21 (KCNA) -- Russia plans to launch five or six satellites of the Glonas system, a global position system (GPS), in the country's two satellite launch centers from August to the end of this year, said a news report.
					
					The satellites are equipped with new devices of the space observation and structural system.

articles.title: Natural Disasters in Different Countries
articles.content:
Natural Disasters in Different Countries

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- Heavy rains recently hit Sind Province, Pakistan, leaving 30 persons killed and more than 60 000 residents homeless.
					
					Victims totaled 700 000.
					
					Rescue operations are now under way on the spot.
					
					Utah officials of the United states called an air pollution alert as smoke from wildfires in Nevada and Idaho fouled air in the Salt Lake City area for the second day Wednesday.
					
					Fire officials said the Twin fire in the western desert of Utah was contained Wednesday at 350 acres.

articles.title: Six Palestinians Killed in Zionist Air Strike
articles.content:
Six Palestinians Killed in Zionist Air Strike

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- Israeli troops are committing ceaseless killings of Palestinians despite protest and condemnation by the world community. 
					
					At least six Palestinians, including a leader of the Palestinian group known as Popular Resistance Committee (PRC) were killed in a series of Zionist regime's air strikes on the Southern Gaza Strip on Thursday.
					
					A nine-year-old Palestinian boy was among the victims of the Zionist air strikes on southern Gaza strip.

articles.title: SADC Committed to Peaceful Solutions to Conflicts: Angolan President
articles.content:
SADC Committed to Peaceful Solutions to Conflicts: Angolan President

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- Angolan President Jose Eduardo dos Santos said on Thursday that the Southern African Development Community (SADC) was committed to peaceful solutions to conflicts and had an obligation to promote dialog because the use of war and violence will only cause damage to nations.
					
					Jose Eduardo dos Santos made the remarks at the closing ceremony of the 31st summit.
					
					President Eduardo dos Santos said most of the countries in the region concluded that peace and security are the cornerstone to build up the region.

articles.title: Venezuela to Nationalize Gold Production
articles.content:
Venezuela to Nationalize Gold Production

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez announced Wednesday he would nationalize gold mining to boost the country's international reserves.
					
					Chavez made the announcement during a phone call aired by state television. He also called on the military to help crack down on the illegal mining and gold smuggling.

articles.title: Dengue Fever Cleanup Drive Ordered in Philippines
articles.content:
Dengue Fever Cleanup Drive Ordered in Philippines

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- The Philippine government on Wednesday called on all local officials, from governors down to village chairmen, as well as local health officials to conduct cleanup activities in their respective localities against dengue fever.
					
					Department of Interior and Local Government Secretary Jesse Robredo enjoined local officials to conduct search and destroy operations of all potential breeding places of dengue-carrying mosquitoes in their areas of jurisdiction.
					
					Robredo issued the directive amid reports from the Department of Health that dengue cases in the country, from Jan. 1 to July 23, 2011, has reached 38 876, or 25.85 percent lower compared with the 52 428 cases in 2010.

articles.title: Crimes in Different Countries
articles.content:
Crimes in Different Countries

					Pyongyang, August 22 (KCNA) -- Uzbek border guards have seized 5 kg of heroin on a Dushanbe-Moscow train traveling through Uzbekistan, the Interfax news agency reported on Thursday.
					
					This was the 7th confiscation of large amount of drugs on Uzbek-Tajik border in the past two months. The total weight of the seized drugs exceeds 50 kg.
					
					A multi-agency task force has arrested 17 members from five rival gangs in massive raids conducted in Southern California on Wednesday morning, authorities said.
					
					Six handguns and narcotics including methamphetamine, Ecstasy and marijuana were seized by authorities.
					
					Italian police have seized a shipment which contained nearly a ton of pure cocaine in northern Italy, local media reported on Thursday.
					
					A few policemen arrested three Italians, a Spaniard and a Colombian.
					
					The police reportedly also seized five new cars on the ship and found 10 kilos of hashish inside one of the vehicles.

articles.title: Iran Protests against UK Police Crackdown
articles.content:
Iran Protests against UK Police Crackdown

					Tehran, August 21 (KCNA) -- Recently, the Iranian Ministry of Foreign Affairs summoned the British charge d'affaires in Tehran to protest against the UK police's harsh crackdown on civilian demonstrators.
					
					A senior official of the ministry conveyed a protest note to the charge d'affaires, reiterating the Iranian government's deep concern about the police's crackdown.

articles.title: Declara la disposicion legal de bienes de la parte Sur en el monte Kumgang
articles.content:
Declara la disposicion legal de bienes de la parte Sur en el monte Kumgang

					Pyongyang, 22 de agosto (ACNC) -- El portavoz de la Direccion de la Zona Especial del Turismo Internacional al Monte Kumgang de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea publico este lunes la siguiente declaracion:
					
					Recientemente, entre ambas partes coreanas tuvo lugar en varias ocasiones el contacto sobre el ajuste  de los bienes de la parte Sur en la zona del monte Kumgang.
					
					Esta labor es una medida fraternal tomada por nuestra parte (Republica Popular Democratica de Corea) para defender las propiedades de las empresas surcoreanas y garantizar sus actividades lucrativas en virtud de la ley de la zona especial del turismo internacional al monte Kumgang.
					
					Para proteger los bienes de las empresas surcoreanas que sufren enormes perdidas debido a la suspension unilateral del turismo por las autoridades surcoreanas, nuestra parte realizo todos los esfuerzos sinceros como preparar hasta ahora varias veces la oportunidad de negociar y plantear diferentes opciones para que aquellas puedan disponer sus propiedades como les convenga.
					
					Pero, las autoridades surcoreanas obstaculizaron siniestramente esa labor cuestionandola absurdamente como supuesta "violacion del acuerdo" y "violacion del derecho sobre las propiedades" y a la ultima hora, recurrieron abiertamente a la tactica dilatoria inventando subterfugios.
					
					Nuestra parte trato de resolver el problema mediante negociaciones posponiendo repetidamente la fecha de limite. 
					
					Pero, dado que las autoridades surcoreanas siguen obstaculizando ese trabajo, nuestra parte, como ya habia avisado previamente, notifico el 29 de julio que segun su ley correspondiente, se ve obligada a ejecutar el ajuste de las propiedades de la parte Sur y que las tratara severamente si las empresas surcoreanas no asisten a esa tramitacion dentro de tres semanas, reconociendo que ellas renunciaron completamente su derecho a las propiedades.
					
					Aun en esa ocasion, hemos mostrado el gesto de magnanimidad dilatando el periodo de moratoria en el caso de las empresas que acepten asistir a la tramitacion de disposicion legal de sus propiedades y dandoles la posibilidad de escoger el metodo conveniente.
					
					A pesar de ello, la banda de titeres surcoreanos desestimo hasta esa ultima oportunidad ofrecida por nuestra parte y se muestra desafiante hablando de la supuesta "apelacion".
					
					Es una conducta muy cinica que ellos hablaran de la "violacion del acuerdo y del derecho sobre las propiedades" porque ellos mismos rompieron el acuerdo entre nuestra parte y el Grupo Hyundai sobre el turismo al monte Kumgang y despreciaron nuestros esfuerzos sinceros y pacientes por ese derecho de las empresas surcoreanas.
					
					Sera avergonzada y ridiculizada esa banda si se atreve a "apelar" porque ella ha suspendido unilateralmente por 3 anos el turismo al monte Kumgang y lo ha dejado sin perspectivas.
					
					A traves del contacto sostenido el dia 19, hemos confirmado definitivamente que la banda surcoreana no tiene la intencion de reiniciar el turismo al monte Kumgang ni quiere aceptar la disposicion de propiedades sino persigue unicamente el siniestro intento de malemplear la noble labor turistica en los fines conflictivos con la connacional RPDC.
					
					Esta claro que no se aplicara mas la indulgencia ni la magnanimidad a los bribones que actuan a sus caprichos sin registrar sus negocios en nuestra zona jurisdiccional.
					
					Puesto que las autoridades surcoreanas negaron hasta el final el reinicio del turismo al monte Kumgang y el registro de propiedades pese a nuestros esfuerzos sinceros, la Direccion de la Zona Especial del Turismo Internacional al Monte Kumgang de la RPDC declara solemnemente que tomara las siguientes medidas segun los codigos correspondientes como los articulos 26, 40, etc. de la ley de dicha zona especial.
					
					Primero, considerando que las autoridades surcoreanas renunciaron completamente la proteccion de propiedades e intereses de las empresas de la parte surcoreana, ejecutamos desde ahora la disposicion legal de todos los bienes, incluyendo los inmuebles, equipos y medios de transporte de la parte Sur en Zona Especial del Turismo Internacional al Monte Kumgang.
					
					Segundo, suspendemos desde la hora 0 del dia 21 la salida de los materiales y bienes de las empresas surcoreanas introducidos en el monte Kumgang.
					
					Tercero, el personal surcoreano, que se queda en la zona especial, debe salir de este lugar dentro de 72 horas.
					
					La camarilla de conservadores titeres es totalmente responsable de la actual coyuntura del turismo al monte Kumgang, que se desarrollaba centrando la atencion de todos los coreanos y el mundo, y tal crimen de ellos sera condenado y denunciado por nuestra nacion de generacion en generacion.

articles.title: En Pyongyang delegacion militar de Rusia
articles.content:
En Pyongyang delegacion militar de Rusia

					Pyongyang, 22 de agosto (ACNC) -- Llego el dia 22 a esta capital la delegacion del Distrito Militar de Este de las Fuerzas Armadas de la Federacion Rusa presidida por el comandante Konstantin Sidenko.

articles.title: Primera Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias de Rason
articles.content:
Primera Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias de Rason

					Rason, 22 de agosto (ACNC) -- Quedo inaugurada el dia 22 en esta ciudad, zona economica y comercial de la parte nordeste de Corea colindada con China y Rusia, la primera Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias de Rason.
					
					Los participantes en el acto rindieron tributo al Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente  Kim Jong Il tras depositar los ramos de flores ante sus retratos en el salon de exhibicion de Rason.
					
					En la ceremonia inaugural participaron Jo Jong Ho, presidente del Comite Popular de la Ciudad de Rason y del Comite organizador del certamen, y otros funcionarios correspondientes, los funcionarios, cientificos y tecnicos de las unidades en la ciudad de Rason que exhibieron sus mercancias, los delegados de varios paises y regiones, los exhibidores, los empresarios extranjeros en esta zona economica y comercial y los consules generales de China y Rusia acreditados en Chongjin.
					
					En el acto hubo el los discursos de apertura y de felicitacion.
					
					Los oradores senalaron que tiene lugar la primera exposicion internacional de mercancias de Rason gracias a los esfuerzos conjuntos de los gobiernos, organos economicos, companias comerciales y personalidades de varios paises.
					
					En el certamen se realizaran las actividades economicas y comerciales multilaterales e intercambio cientifico-tecnico, senalaron y desearon que los participantes logren excelentes exitos a traves de amplios contactos.
					
					Al termino del acto inaugural, los participantes vieron los articulos electricos y electronicos, los productos de industria ligera, los alimentos y medicinas, los medios de transporte, etc. expuestos por mas de 110 unidades de Corea, China, Rusia, Australia, Italia, Estados Unidos y Taipei de China.
					
					El mismo dia, hubo un banquete por la ceremonia  inaugural de la Exposicion.

articles.title: Minju Joson denuncia confabulacion del Sur de Corea con Japon
articles.content:
Minju Joson denuncia confabulacion del Sur de Corea con Japon

					Pyongyang, 22 de agosto (ACNC) -- El rotativo Minju Joson publico en su edicion del dia 21 un comentario individual denunciando a las autoridades surcoreanas que en estos dias instigan las maniobras de los reaccionarios japoneses tendentes a usurpar el islote Tok y anotar el Mar Este de Corea como el "Mar de Japon". 
					
					El culpable debe pedir disculpas y hacer indemnizacion merecida a la victima, de acuerdo con la ley internacional, senala el comentario y prosigue: 
					
					Sin embargo, los reaccionarios japoneses se entregan a las maniobras de nueva agresion, lejos de liquidar el pasado criminal. 
					
					Lo problematico es que las autoridades conservadoras del Sur de Corea instigan tales maniobras de nueva agresion. 
					
					Como esta conocido por todo el mundo, los conservadores surcoreanos instruyeron al embajador acreditado en Japon que "ignore las provocaciones de Japon en cuanto al islote Tok". 
					
					Bajo el amparo de esta actitud vendepatria y projaponesa del Sur de Corea, los reaccionarios japoneses vinieron intensificando las maniobras de usurpacion del islote Tok. 
					
					Hace poco, en cuanto al vuelo de prueba de un avion de pasajeros del Sur de Corea en el espacio aereo del islote Tok, Japon armo alboroto durante un mes, prohibio usar aviones surcoreanos de pasajeros y promovio el plan de visita de los parlamentarios del Partido Democratico Liberal de Japon a la isla Ullung.
					
					Ademas, en el "discurso conmemorativo del 15 de agosto", el gobernante surcoreano no menciono ni una palabra sobre el intento de Japon de usurpar el islote Tok, lo cual es una traicion nunca tolerable que estimula a los reaccionarios japoneses a la nueva agresion.
					
					Entonces, ?que objetivo persiguen las autoridades conservadoras surcoreanas? Es danar a la parte connacional en contubernio con los reaccionarios japoneses. 
					
					Es por eso que Japon se desespera tan freneticamente para usurpar el islote Tok durante el mandato actual de la banda conservadora surcoreana.
